intro: Ruelingia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ruelingia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse growth forms. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Ruelingia angustifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
